intro: Tabernaemontana psorocarpa, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a velvety texture, while the fruit is a capsule that splits open to release the seeds.
